description.narrative: The intervention has the purpose to contribute to the construction of a peaceful society with stable state institutions. To reach this global objective, the cooperation partner identified three main axes which are the following ones: Axis 1: Strengthening constitutionalism, the rule of law and political and socioeconomic governance;Axis 2: Promoting civic awareness, civility, social cohesion and good governance in the security sector;Axis 3: Institutional support and organizational strengthening of the CGD. .

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

description.narrative:
The information below is taken from the semi-annual report and discussions with the CGD:
The CGD organized training sessions for its 13 student-cells located at four universities in Ouagadougou, Bobo-Dioulasso, Koudougou and Dedougou. These cells are incubators for the training of a future leadership that promotes the values of democracy, good governance and human rights. Each cell is made up of 80 students, 40 girls and 40 boys. The theme of this years training sessions was "Women and Men for a equitable society". When done with the training, the participants are expected to act as ambassadors for the values of CGD and in particular for gender equality.
The CGD also organized a training for the beneifit of its 45 so called "sentinels" which are individuals chosen by the CGD for their civic committment and attendance at CGD events. With a view to promote civic paritcipation through citizen monitoring of public policies, a training workshop, made up of three modules was then organized for the sentinels. The modules covered 1) the mission and objectives of the CGD; 2) public policies, defintions, typology, formulation and implementation; 3) Citizen control of public policy. The training sessions will allow the sentinels to go back to their respective communities better equiped to monitor public policy.
Training sessions on citizen monitoring of the local development mining fund were organized in Yalgo and Houndé. These sessions were attended by 70 people, including 30 women. The focus of the sessions were local monitoring local development mining fund and on the environmental and social impact of mining activities in the local communities. An exchange was also held between the local population, the CGD and representatives of large companies. Here CGD advocated for the importance of excluding the local economy and labour force from the fruits of the extractive mining industry.
The CGD organized a training session for 70 people from local security initiatives (Dozo, Kologweogo, Rouga) on the importance of respecting human rights and democratic values with a view to reducing human rights violations by local security initiatives.
A workshop was organized that brought together actors involved in the governance of the security sector around the theme: "Contribution of civil society organizations in the co-production of security, peace and national defense." It was attended by the internal security forces, the army, the ministries in charge, CSOs and other stakeholderes. It allowed an analysis by the actors of the relevance of the contribution of civil society in the quest for security. It also allowed for the formulation of recommendations that will be addressed to decision makers in the form of decision-making tools.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
